PSA: This Course will no longer be available June 30th 2016 onwards
                            Coursera announced that they will be shutting off their old platform on June 30th. Over  400 courses that are part
                                of the old stack will be no longer be available. You can find the  complete list here.
                            
                            

                            
                                Read this guide to learn how to download this course before the old platform shuts down. 

                                The guide provides two ways to download the courses - Chrome Plugin and Python Script. Depending on which method you use, check the appropriate sections below for further details.
                            
                            
                            
                                To download this course you need to be enrolled in the course.
                                                                    You can enroll for the course here:
                                    https://www.coursera.org/course/ourearth
                                                            

                            Chrome Plugin

                                                            You can download the course materials for this course by visiting the following url (you need to be logged in):
                                                                        https://class.coursera.org/ourearth-003/lecture
                                
                            
                            Python Script
                            
                                                                For the python script to work you will need a class name. Pick one from below:
                                                                    ourearth-001
                                                                    ourearth-002
                                                                    ourearth-003
                                
                                
                                If more than one class name below, pick the last one. If the script fails, pick the one above that and try again. Not all of these class names are guranteed to work.


                            






                        
                    
                    This course focuses on a basic science understanding that demonstrates how the processes on Earth (including biological processes) lead to natural climate changes that have shaped the planet and the path of evolution. Students are challenged to think of the Earth as an integrated system made up of water, air, ice, land, and life.  For example, students learn that the rise of oxygen in the atmosphere 2.5 billion years ago produced massive extinctions of life on Earth that forever altered the dominant types of single-celled life.  Students are exposed to how new scientific discoveries are made through the observations that led to plate tectonics, how the Moon formed, and why dinosaurs went extinct.

                                            Syllabus
                        1.  Building blocks of the Earth's climateHow science worksHow Earth's climate worksWhat is geologic time?Rocks and mineralsHow old is the Earth?2. Formation, evolution, and processes of the solid EarthFormation of the EarthFormation of the MoonPlate tectonicsThe first continentsEarth's magnetic fieldMid-ocean ridges and subduction zonesSupercontinentsContinent–continent collisions (Example: the Himalaya)3. Water in the Earth's climate system: Oceans, atmosphere, and cryosphereThe oceans: How they regulate the Earth's climateThe cryosphere: Ice on our planetThe atmosphere: Our protective layer and weather-maker4. Life, and its effect on the Earth's climate systemEvolution of the atmosphereSingle cells and hard shellsLife on landDeath from above (and below): Mass extinctionsThe course presents four weeks of primary content, but runs for five weeks to allow students time to complete all assignments. Although the course is structured as separate weeks, all material will be available from the beginning.
title: Our Earth: Its Climate, History, and Processes
